member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.AbortCurrentHandlerException
member.summary: Represents an exception which indicates that any additional logic for the current message handler should be aborted and skipped.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.ChannelEnvelope

member.summary: Represents a loopback address used for dispatching a message to a local endpoint.

member.summary: Represents the address used for dispatching a message to the dead or expired letter queue

member.summary: Represents the address used for dispatching a message to the unhandled message queue

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.ChannelGroupFactory
member.summary: Provides the ability to construct a new channel group.

The configuration of the channel group to be constructed.
member.returns: A new object instance of the named channel group specified.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IMessagingChannel
member.summary: Represents partition used to separate activities over a single connection to messaging infrastructure.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are single threaded and should not be shared between threads.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IDeliveryContext
member.summary: Represents the delivery of a single message on a particular channel. Where transactional messaging is a available, the send operation will occur within the bounds of the receiving transaction.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are single threaded and should not be shared between threads.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDeliveryContext.PrepareDispatch(System.Object,NanoMessageBus.IMessagingChannel)
member.summary: Prepares a dispatch for transmission.
member.param: The optional message to be dispatched; a set of messages can be provided later if necessary.
The optional channel to be used for dispatching. If none is specified, the current channel will be used.
member.returns: A new instance of a dispatch to be prepared for transmission.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IDeliveryContext.Active
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current delivery and subsequent dispatches can continue successfully.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IDeliveryContext.CurrentMessage
member.summary: Gets the current inbound message being handled on the channel.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IDeliveryContext.CurrentResolver
member.summary: Gets an optional reference to the object used to resolve dependencies.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IDeliveryContext.CurrentTransaction
member.summary: Gets the current transaction associated with the channel, if transactions are available.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IDeliveryContext.CurrentConfiguration
member.summary: Gets the current configuration associated with the channel.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IMessagingChannel.BeginShutdown
member.summary: Initiates the process shutting down the channel to prevent additional sends and/or receives from occurring on the channel.
member.remarks: This is the only thread-safe method that can be invoked on the channel.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IMessagingChannel.Receive(System.Action{NanoMessageBus.IDeliveryContext})
member.summary: Begins receiving messages from the channel and dispatches them to the callback provided.
member.param: The callback to which the received message should be dispatched.
member.remarks: The timeout, if any, has been specified as part of the channel configuration.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IMessagingChannel.Send(NanoMessageBus.ChannelEnvelope)
member.summary: Sends the message specified to the destinations provided.
member.param: The envelope which contains the message and set of intended recipients.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IChannelConnector
member.summary: Provides the ability to open, establish, and maintain a connection to the messaging infrastructure.
member.remarks: Instances of this class must be designed to be multi-thread safe such that they can be shared between threads.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IChannelConnector.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a channel against the underlying connection.
member.param: The channel group indicating how the channel is to be configured.
member.returns: An open channel through which messages may be sent or received according to the configuration.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelConnector.CurrentState
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the current state underlying connection.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelConnector.ChannelGroups
member.summary: Gets the set of values which uniquely identify the channel groups to be created.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.ConnectionState
member.summary: Represents the state of the underlying connection at various critical points.

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.ConnectionState.Closed
member.summary: The connection is closed and no operations can be performed until the connection is reestablished.

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.ConnectionState.Opening
member.summary: The connection is opening and being initialized.

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.ConnectionState.Open
member.summary: The connection is open and ready for work.

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.ConnectionState.Closing
member.summary: The connection is shutting down and performing any cleanup necessary.

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.ConnectionState.Disconnected
member.summary: The endpoint was previously available and attempts to re-open the connection are being made.

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.ConnectionState.Unauthenticated
member.summary: Indicates that the current security credentials are incorrect.

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.ConnectionState.Unauthorized
member.summary: Indicates that the current security context does not contain the necessary privileges.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.ChannelShutdownException
member.summary: Represents an exception that is thrown when any send or receive operations are attempted against a channel which is shutting down or has been shutdown.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.PoisonMessageException
member.summary: Represents an exception that occurs when a message cannot be properly deserialized or when a component in the message pipeline decides the message should cannot be successfully processed.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.DeadLetterException
member.summary: Represents an exception that occurs when an expired (dead on the wire) message is received.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroup
member.summary: Represents a set of channels which operate connect to the same physical endpoint location and which operate as a cohesive unit.
member.remarks: Instances of this class must be designed to be multi-thread safe such that they can be shared between threads.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroup.Initialize
member.summary: Starts up the underlying connector, initializes all channels associated with the group, and otherwise prepares the channel group to process and dispatch messages.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroup.OpenChannel
member.summary: Creates a messaging channel that is not controlled or tracked by channel group and which is owned and controlled by the caller.
member.returns: If the messaging infrastructure is available, it returns a reference to a new channel.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroup.BeginReceive(System.Action{NanoMessageBus.IDeliveryContext})
member.summary: Begins streaming any available inbound messages to the callback provided; for dispatch-only groups it throws an exception.
member.param: The callback to which any received messages should be dispatched.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroup.BeginDispatch(System.Action{NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext})
member.summary: For dispatch-only channel groups, it adds the callback provided to an in-memory queue for asynchronous invocation; for full-duplex channel groups (send/receive), it throws an exception.
member.param: The callback which creates and prepares a message for dispatch.
member.returns: A value indicating whether or not the channel could add the item to the in-memory queue.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroup.DispatchOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the channel group is a dispatch-only (non-receiving) group.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IChannelMessageBuilder
member.summary: Provides the ability to build a channel message.
member.remarks: Instances of this class must be designed to be multi-thread safe such that they can be shared between threads.

member.summary: Builds a new instance of the ChannelMessage class.
member.param: The value which uniquely identifies the conversation to which the message belongs.
The address to which all replies should be directed.
The set of headers or metadata the ride along with the message.
The set of logical, application-level messages to be dispatched.
member.returns: A new instance of the ChannelMessage class.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext
member.summary: Provides the ability to assemble a message and associated metadata piece by piece for transmission.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are single threaded and should not be shared between threads.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.WithMessage(System.Object)
member.summary: Appends a single message to the dispatch.
member.param: The message to be dispatched.
member.returns: A instance to the same dispatch to facilitate fluent construction.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.WithMessages(System.Object[])
member.summary: Appends a set of messages to the dispatch.
member.param: The set of messages to be dispatched.
member.returns: A instance to the same dispatch to facilitate fluent construction.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.WithCorrelationId(System.Guid)
member.summary: Assigns the correlation identifier specified to the dispatch.
member.param: The correlation (or conversation) identifier of the dispatch.
member.returns: A instance to the same dispatch to facilitate fluent construction.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.WithHeader(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Appends a header to the message metadata.
member.param: The header name; if the same value is specified multiple times, the most recent value wins.
The value of the header; if the value is null, the associated header is removed.
member.returns: A instance to the same dispatch to facilitate fluent construction.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.WithHeaders(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Appends a set of headers to the message metadata.
member.param: The headers to be applied.
member.returns: A instance to the same dispatch to facilitate fluent construction.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.WithRecipient(System.Uri)
member.summary: Specifies an additional recipient for the dispatch beyond those obtained for the underlying dispatch table.
member.param: The additional recipient to whom the dispatch should be transmitted.
member.returns: A instance to the same dispatch to facilitate fluent construction.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.WithState(System.Object)
member.summary: Specifies additional state to be added to the outbound dispatch envelope for evaluation by the upstream pipeline while in the current application process space.
member.param: The value indicating temporary state to be applied to the outbound dispatch envelope.
member.returns: A instance to the same dispatch to facilitate fluent construction.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.Send(System.Object[])
member.summary: Pushes the message onto the underlying channel sending it to any interested parties and completes the context.
member.param: The messages to be dispatched as part of the operation.
member.returns: The current transaction.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.Publish(System.Object[])
member.summary: Pushes the message onto the underlying channel publishing it to all interested parties, and completes the context.
member.remarks: The first message in the transmission will be used to determine message type, and thus, the recipients of the message.
member.param: The messages to be dispatched as part of the operation.
member.returns: The current transaction.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.Reply(System.Object[])
member.summary: Pushes the message onto the channel sending it to the original sender, if any, and completes the context.
member.param: The messages to be dispatched as part of the operation.
member.returns: The current transaction.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.MessageCount
member.summary: Gets the number of logical, business-specific messages pending dispatch.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchContext.HeaderCount
member.summary: Gets the number of headers that have been added to the pending dispatch.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IHandlerContext

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IHandlerContext.DropMessage
member.summary: Stops handling the current channel message and consumes the message.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IHandlerContext.DeferMessage
member.summary: Stops handling the channel message and re-enqueues it for later delivery.

member.summary: Creates all channel groups and the initializes each of them and returns the first one.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.MessagingWireup
member.summary: Performs the primary wireup to create an active instance of the host.
member.remarks: This class is designed to be used during the wireup process and then thrown away.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IRoutingTable
member.summary: Provides the ability to route a given message to one or more registered handlers. In addition, multiple routing tables can be used by an IoC-managed application to have different routes depending upon which table is resolved for a given incoming message.
member.remarks: Instances of this class must be designed to be multi-thread safe such that they can be shared between threads. At the same time, routes should only be added to instances of this class during wireup rather than at runtime.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IRoutingTable.Add``1(NanoMessageBus.IMessageHandler{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a route to the handler provided using the optional sequence specified. Adding the same handler multiple times will result in the most recent registration being used.
member.typeparam: The type of message to be handled.
member.param: The handler into which the message will be routed.
The optional value which indicates priority over other handles for the same message.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IRoutingTable.Add``1(System.Func{NanoMessageBus.IHandlerContext,NanoMessageBus.IMessageHandler{``0}},System.Int32,System.Type)
member.summary: Adds a route to the handler provided using the optional sequence specified. When the handler type is specified, adding the same handler multiple times will result in the most recent registration being used.
member.typeparam: The type of message to be handled.
member.param: The callback used to resolve the handler instance into which the message will be routed.
The optional value which indicates priority over other handles for the same message.
The optional type which indicates the type of handler to be returned by the handler callback.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IRoutingTable.Route(NanoMessageBus.IHandlerContext,System.Object)
member.summary: Routes the message provided to the associated message handlers.
member.param: The context surrounding the handling of the channel message.
The logical message to be routed to the associated handlers.
member.returns: The routes into which the message was routed.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchTable
member.summary: Provides the ability to determine the set of recipients (by address) for a given type of message.
member.remarks: Instances of this class must be designed to be multi-thread safe such that they can be shared between threads.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchTable.AddSubscriber(System.Uri,System.Type,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Adds the subscriber to the set of subscribers for the specified message type.
member.param: The address of the subscriber to be added.
The type of message in which the subscriber is interested.
The point in time at which the subscription for the given type will expire.
member.remarks: Subscribers are used when "publishing" a message. Multiple calls will only add the subscriber once with the latest expiration value provided being used.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchTable.AddRecipient(System.Uri,System.Type)
member.summary: Adds a recipient to the set of recipients for the specified message type.
member.param: The address of the recipient to be added.
The type of message in which the subscriber is interested.
member.remarks: Recipients are used when "sending" a message.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchTable.Remove(System.Uri,System.Type)
member.summary: Removes the subscriber or recipient from the set of subscribers for the specified message type.
member.param: The address of the subscriber or recipient to be removed.
The type of message in which the subscriber or recipient is no longer interested.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IDispatchTable.Item(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the set of recipients of the message type specified.
member.param: The type of message to use when determining the set of subscribers.
member.returns: The set addresses for all registered subscribers for the given message type, if any.

member.summary: Instructs the worker to perform the operation indicated.
member.param: The operation to be performed by the worker.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IWorkItem`1.ActiveWorkers
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates the number of active workers performing the activity.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IWorkItem`1.State
member.summary: Gets the state associated with the activity.

member.summary: Gets the value which uniquely identifies the named configuration or channel group.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.Synchronous
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the particular configuration should support asynchronous operations.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.DispatchOnly

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.MaxDispatchBuffer
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the maximum number of items allowed in the dispatch-only buffer

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.MinWorkers
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the minimum number of workers to be allocated for work.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.MaxWorkers
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the maximum allowable number of workers to be allocated for work.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.ReturnAddress
member.summary: Gets the URI representing the address to which all reply messages will be sent.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.MessageBuilder
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object instance used to build new, outbound channel messages.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.ReceiveTimeout
member.summary: Gets the length of time to await the receipt of a message from a channel before resume other work.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.DependencyResolver
member.summary: Gets an optional reference to resolver used to manage dependencies.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelGroupConfiguration.DispatchTable
member.summary: Gets a reference to the dispatch table to determine the appropriate recipients for a given type of message.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IChannelTransaction
member.summary: For supported channels, represents a set of messaging activities on the channel (such as receive and send) that happen as a unit or not all.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are single threaded and should not be shared between threads.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IChannelTransaction.Register(System.Action)
member.summary: Registers the associated action with the transaction.
member.param: The action to be invoked when the transaction is committed.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IChannelTransaction.Commit
member.summary: Invokes the registered callbacks to mark the transaction as complete.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IChannelTransaction.Rollback
member.summary: Rolls back any work performed.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.IChannelTransaction.Finished
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the transaction has been committed, rolled back, or disposed;

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage
member.summary: Represents an atomic unit of communication--a message or communiqu√©--that can or has been transported over a communication medium, which holds both the messages and metadata about those messages.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.MoveNext
member.summary: Sets the current active message to the next available message, if any, and increments the active index.
member.returns: If successful, returns true; otherwise false.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Guid,System.Uri,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Object})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ChannelMessage class.
member.param: The value which uniquely identifies the message.
The value which attaches the message to a larger conversation.
The address to which all replies should be directed.
The message headers which contain additional metadata about the contained messages.
The collection of contained messages.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ChannelMessage class.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.MessageId
member.summary: Gets the value which uniquely identifies the message.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.CorrelationId
member.summary: Gets the value which attaches the message to a larger conversation.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.ReturnAddress
member.summary: Gets the address to which all replies should be directed.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.Headers
member.summary: Gets the message headers which contain additional metadata about the contained messages.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.Messages
member.summary: Gets the collection of contained messages.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.ActiveMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to the active logical message currently being handled.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.ActiveIndex
member.summary: Gets a value which indicates the index of the logical message currently being handled.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.Expiration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of time the message will live prior to successful receipt.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.Persistent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the message is durably stored.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.ChannelMessage.Dispatched
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the point in time at which the message was dispatched.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.IWorkerGroup`1
member.summary: Represents a set of concurrent workers that perform activities.
member.typeparam: The state held by the worker.
member.remarks: Instances of this class must be designed to be multi-thread safe such that they can be shared between threads.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IWorkerGroup`1.Initialize(System.Func{`0},System.Func{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Initializes the factory and causes all future worker groups to use the callbacks provided.
member.param: The callback used to get the state of the worker.
The callback used to restart the workers.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IWorkerGroup`1.StartActivity(System.Action{NanoMessageBus.IWorkItem{`0}})
member.summary: Builds a worker group which starts performing the activity specified.
member.param: The activity to be performed by the workers.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IWorkerGroup`1.StartQueue
member.summary: Builds a worker group which watches a work item queue.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IWorkerGroup`1.Restart
member.summary: Initiates the stopping and restarting of the activity currently being performed.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.IWorkerGroup`1.Enqueue(System.Action{NanoMessageBus.IWorkItem{`0}})
member.summary: Adds a work item to be performed by one of the workers within the worker group. Work items can safely be added at any time during the lifetime of the object instance.
member.param: The callback representing the work item to be enqueued and invoked at a later time by one of the workers.
member.returns: If the value was enqueued, returns true; otherwise false.

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.Serialization.ISerializer
member.summary: Provides the ability to serialize and deserialize an object graph.
member.remarks: Instances of this class must be designed to be multi-thread safe such that they can be shared between threads.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.Serialization.ISerializer.Serialize(System.IO.Stream,System.Object)
member.summary: Serializes the object graph provided and writes a serialized representation to the output stream provided.
member.param: The stream into which the serialized object graph should be written.
The object graph to be serialized.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.Serialization.ISerializer.Deserialize(System.IO.Stream,System.Type,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Deserializes the stream provided and reconstructs the corresponding object graph.
member.param: The stream of bytes from which the object will be reconstructed.
The type to be deserialized.
The optional value which indicates the format used during serialization.
The optional value which indicates the encoding used during serialization.
member.returns: The reconstructed object.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.Serialization.ISerializer.ContentEncoding
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates the encoding mechanism used (gzip, bzip2, lzma, aes, etc.)

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.Serialization.ISerializer.ContentFormat
member.summary: Gets the MIME-type suffix (json, xml, binary, etc.)

member.name: T:NanoMessageBus.SystemTime
member.summary: Provides the ability to override the current moment in time to facilitate testing. Original idea by Ayende Rahien: http://ayende.com/Blog/archive/2008/07/07/Dealing-with-time-in-tests.aspx

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.SystemTime.EpochTime
member.summary: Represents "zero" for Unix Epoch Time.

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.SystemTime.TimeResolver
member.summary: The callback to be used to resolve the current moment in time.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.SystemTime.ToEpochTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the number of milliseconds that have elapsed between the instant and Unix Epoch Time (12:00 AM January 1, 1970).
member.param: The instant from which epoch time will be computed.
member.returns: The number of milliseconds that have elapsed since the instant provided.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.SystemTime.ToDateTime(System.Int64)
member.summary: Gets the point in time represented by the instant specified in milliseconds since the epoch.
member.param: The point in time, according to Unix Epoch Time to be converted, expressed in milliseconds.
member.returns: The point in time expressed as a DateTime.

member.name: F:NanoMessageBus.SystemTime.SleepResolver
member.summary: The callback to be used to instruct the current thread to sleep.

member.name: M:NanoMessageBus.SystemTime.Sleep(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Instructs the current thread to sleep for the specified amount of time.
member.param: The amount of time for the current thread to sleep.

member.name: P:NanoMessageBus.SystemTime.UtcNow
member.summary: Gets the current moment in time.
member.remarks: Method invocation is not thread safe if the resolver is being changed by multiple threads. The intended design is for testing where it can be set, any tests run, and then the value cleared.
